result.execSummary:
All charges against Sherry Lynn Biljan in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sherry Lynn Biljan is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sherry Lynn Biljan

records.addlTxt:
10:16 AM Cases 22CF78 and 22CF124 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sherry Lynn Biljan in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Sherry Lynn Biljan.  State moving to dismiss 22CF78; provides basis.  Court grants motion to dismiss 22CF78.  Case 22CF124 set for preliminary hearing.  Atty Erdman notes there is a misdemeanor offer from DA Rennicke.  Off the record 10:18 AM for ADA Schmidt to get clarification.  Back on the record 10:20 AM, same appearances.  Atty Schmidt clarifies- offer is, if def waives prelim, it will be an offer for a misdemeanor.  Off the record 10:21 AM for def and atty to discuss.  Back on the record, 10:24, same appearances as previously noted.  Atty Erdman updates- def to waive the preliminary hearing, requesting an additional status conference after this hearing.  Case proceeds to Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information mirroring complaint.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Defendant to provide fingerprints to the BCSD before leaving the building today for 22CF124.
Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 11:45 am.
EVENT ENTERED IN ERROR- STATE DISMISSED THIS CHARGE PRIOR TO THE FINDING OF PROBABLE CAUSE; THE MATTER WAS NOT BOUND OVER
Status conference on August 18, 2022 at 11:45 am.

3:35 PM 22CF78 and 22CF124 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sherry Lynn Biljan appeared by video.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Sherry Lynn Biljan.  Cases were set for prelims, def appears by video without approval and late- so atty Erdman unable to proceed with hearing.  Court resets.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.

2:08 PM Cases 22CF78 and 22CF124 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sherry Lynn Biljan appeared by phone.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Sherry Lynn Biljan. Court makes record- def had video issues, reset from 1 to 2 to allow telephone appearance.  Atty Erdman verifies contact information, was unable to reach def.  Case 22CF124 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  WTLPH.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 11, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

2:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sherry Lynn Biljan appeared by Zoom audio. Case on for Status Conference.  Def has not located an atty for def.
Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on June 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on June 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

09:12 AM Defendant, Sherry Lynn Biljan, appeared.  Atty. Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared on behalf of State of Wisconsin.  Sherry Lynn Biljan appeared by video means.  Case on for status conference.  Case needs a prelim, but PD is still attempting to locate an attorney for the defendant.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

01:24 PM Defendant, Sherry Lynn Biljan, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Atty Pollak appears specially, def qualifies.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  WTLPH.  Prior to leaving the courthouse, the defendant shall report to the sheriff's dept. to provide fingerprints.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No contact with the victim or the victim's residence.
